Package org.securecryptoconfig

Class SecureCryptoConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.securecryptoconfig.SecureCryptoConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SecureCryptoConfigInterface
    public class SecureCryptoConfig
extends java.lang.Object
implements SecureCryptoConfigInterface
    Starting point for performing every cryptographic use case. The class contains methods for performing symmetric/asymmetric en/decryption, (password) hashing and signing. Implements the SecureCryptoConfigInterface. To perform the desired use case simply create a new SecureCryptoConfig object and call the specific method: E.g. hashing 
     {
        @code
        SecureCryptoConfig scc = new SecureCryptoConfig();
        SCCHash sccHash = scc.hash(plaintext);
 }
    Author:
    Lisa

    • Constructor Detail

      • SecureCryptoConfig

        public SecureCryptoConfig()

    • Method Detail

      • setSecurityLevel

        public static void setSecurityLevel​(int level)
        Set the latest Secure Crypto Config file of a specific Security level for usage.

        Algorithms that are used for executing the invoked cryptographic use case are looked up in the latest Secure Crypto Config file (according to its version) with the specified Security level
        Parameters:
        level - : integer of desired security level of Secure Crypto Config file

      • getUsedSCC

        public static java.lang.String getUsedSCC()
        Return the policy name of the Secure Crypto Config file that is currently used for executing cryptographic use case
        Returns:
        policyName: policy name of the used Secure Crypto Config file

      • setCustomSCCPath

        public static void setCustomSCCPath​(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Set path to a custom root folder "scc-configs" which contains the Secure Crypto Config files.

        To use the default Secure Config files at "src/scc-configs" again call setDefaultSCC()
        Parameters:
        path - : path to "scc-configs" directory

      • setSCCFile

        public static void setSCCFile​(java.lang.String policyName)
        Set Secure Crypto Config file (with the specified policy name) to use. To use the default Secure Config files at "src/scc-configs" again call setDefaultSCC()
        Parameters:
        policyName - : policy name of the Secure Crypto Config file to use

      • setDefaultSCC

        public static void setDefaultSCC()
        Go back to the usage of Secure Crypto Config files at "src/scc-configs" included inside the library. Only necessary if a custom path with setCustomSCCPath(Path) or setSCCFile(String) was called before.

      • setAlgorithm

        public static void setAlgorithm​(SecureCryptoConfig.SCCAlgorithm algorithm)
        Set a specific algorithm for the execution of the later performed use cases. Possible choices are contained in SecureCryptoConfig.SCCAlgorithm
        E.g. 
         
 SecureCryptoConfig.setAlgorithm(SCCAlgorithm.AES_GCM_256_96);
        To use the default algorithm from the included Secure Crypto Config files again call defaultAlgorithm()
        Parameters:
        algorithm - : one supported algorithm from SecureCryptoConfig.SCCAlgorithm

      • defaultAlgorithm

        public static void defaultAlgorithm()
        Use the algorithms proposed in the currently used Secure Crypto Config file for the execution of the use cases. Only necessary if specific algorithm was set previously via setAlgorithm(SCCAlgorithm)

      • encryptSymmetric

        public SCCCiphertext encryptSymmetric​(org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCKey key,
                                      org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext)
                               throws COSE.CoseException,
                                      java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                      SCCException
        Symmetric encryption with a certain SCCKey for a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file.
        The encryption can be done as follows: 
         
 	SecureCryptoConfig scc = new SecureCryptoConfig();
  SCCCiphertext c = scc.encryptSymmetric(sccKey, plaintext);

        A new SCCKey for performing can be created with SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase) as follows: 
         
 	SCCKey key = SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase.SymmetricEncryption);
        Alternatively it is also possible to create a key derived from a password with SCCKey.createSymmetricKeyWithPassword(byte[]): 
         
 	SCCKey key = SCCKey.createSymmetricKeyWithPassword(password);
        Also it is possible to create a SCCKey from already existing SCCKey byte[] with SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(byte[]):: 
         
 SCCKey key = SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(existingSCCKey)
        A PlaintextContainer representation can be done by calling PlaintextContainer(byte[]) with the byte[] representation of the plaintext to be encrypted.
        Specified by:
        encryptSymmetric in interface SecureCryptoConfigInterface
        Parameters:
        key - : SCCKey
        plaintext - : as PlaintextContainer
        Returns:
        SCCCiphertext
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if SCCKey has not the SCCKey.KeyType.Symmetric
        SCCException

      • hash

        public SCCHash hash​(org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext)
             throws COSE.CoseException,
                    SCCException
        Hashing of a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file.
        The hashing can be done as follows: 
         
 	SecureCryptoConfig scc = new SecureCryptoConfig();
  SCCHash hash = scc.hash(plaintext);
        A PlaintextContainer representation can be done by calling PlaintextContainer(byte[]) with the byte[] representation of the plaintext to be hashed.
        Specified by:
        hash in interface SecureCryptoConfigInterface
        Parameters:
        plaintext - : as PlaintextContainer
        Returns:
        SCCHash
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException
        SCCException

      • validateHash

        public boolean validateHash​(org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext,
                            org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCHash hash)
                     throws COSE.CoseException,
                            SCCException
        Validate a given SCCHash for a specific plaintext. The plaintext will be hashed again and compared if the resulting hash is identical to the provided one.

        A PlaintextContainer representation can be done by calling PlaintextContainer(byte[]) with the byte[] representation of the plaintext to be hashed.
        Specified by:
        validateHash in interface SecureCryptoConfigInterface
        Parameters:
        plaintext - : as PlaintextContainer
        hash - : SCCHash

        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException
        SCCException

      • sign

        public SCCSignature sign​(org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCKey key,
                         org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext)
                  throws COSE.CoseException,
                         java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                         SCCException
        Signing with a certain SCCKey for a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file.
        The signing can be done as follows: 
         
 	SecureCryptoConfig scc = new SecureCryptoConfig();
  SCCSignature sig = scc.sign(sccKey, plaintext);

        A new SCCKey for performing can be created with SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase) as follows: 
         
 	SCCKey key = SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase.Signing);
        Also it is possible to create a SCCKey from already existing SCCKey byte[] with SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(byte[]): 
         
 SCCKey key = SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(existingSCCKey)
        A PlaintextContainer representation can be done by calling PlaintextContainer(byte[]) with the byte[] representation of the plaintext to be signed.
        Specified by:
        sign in interface SecureCryptoConfigInterface
        Parameters:
        key - : SCCKey
        plaintext - : as PlaintextContainer
        Returns:
        SCCSignature
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if SCCKey has not the SCCKey.KeyType.Asymmetric
        SCCException

      • passwordHash

        public SCCPasswordHash passwordHash​(org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface password)
                             throws COSE.CoseException,
                                    SCCException
        Hash a password based on the current Secure Crypto Config file.
        The password hashing can be done as follows: 
         
 	SecureCryptoConfig scc = new SecureCryptoConfig();
  SCCPasswordHash hash = scc.passwordHash(password);
        A PlaintextContainer representation can be done by calling PlaintextContainer(byte[]) with the byte[] representation of the password to be hashed.
        Specified by:
        passwordHash in interface SecureCryptoConfigInterface
        Parameters:
        password - : as PlaintextContainer
        Returns:
        SCCPasswordHash
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException
        SCCException

      • passwordHash

        public SCCPasswordHash passwordHash​(byte[] password)
                             throws COSE.CoseException,
                                    SCCException
        Hash a password based on the current Secure Crypto Config file.
        The password hashing can be done as follows: 
         
 	SecureCryptoConfig scc = new SecureCryptoConfig();
  SCCPasswordHash hash = scc.passwordHash(password);
        Specified by:
        passwordHash in interface SecureCryptoConfigInterface
        Parameters:
        password - : as byte[]
        Returns:
        SCCPasswordHash
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException
        SCCException

      • validatePasswordHash

        public boolean validatePasswordHash​(org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface password,
                                    org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCPasswordHash passwordhash)
                             throws COSE.CoseException,
                                    SCCException
        Validate a given SCCPasswordHash against given password. The password will be hashed again and compared if resulting hash is identical to the given one.
        Specified by:
        validatePasswordHash in interface SecureCryptoConfigInterface
        Parameters:
        password - : as PlaintextContainer
        passwordhash - : SCCPasswordHash
        Returns:
        boolean
        Throws:
        COSE.CoseException
        SCCException
